snippet: After Marcell Dockery, 16, was arrested last month, he told police that he was bored when he started a fire in a Brooklyn high-rise that led to Officer Dennis Guerra’s death.
abstract: Defense lawyer for Marcell Dockery, Coney Island teenager charged with murder for starting a fire that led to death of police officer Dennis Guerra, says he will argue that his client gave a false confession because it was coerced; Dockery told police that boredom led him to start the fire.
lead_paragraph: After Marcell Dockery, 16, was arrested last month, he told police that he was bored when he started a fire in a Brooklyn high-rise that led to Officer Dennis Guerra’s death.

headline.main: Lawyer Says Confession in Fatal Fire Was Coerced
headline.print_headline: Lawyer Says Confession in Fatal Fire Was Coerced
